byline.contributor: Douglas Dalby reported from Dublin, and Dan Bilefsky from London.
byline.original: By DOUGLAS DALBY and DAN BILEFSKY

abstract: Many Irish citizens who live abroad traveled back to cast affirmative vote for referendum on constitutional amendment to make gay marriage legal; even some members of Roman Catholic clergy publicly voice their support.
lead_paragraph: The referendum had the potential to be historic, as the first electoral endorsement by a country of the right to same-sex marriages. Results were expected Saturday.

headline.main: Ireland Votes in Referendum on Same-Sex Marriage
headline.print_headline: Turnout Is High as Irish Vote in Referendum on Same-Sex Marriage

snippet: The referendum had the potential to be historic, as the first electoral endorsement by a country of the right to same-sex marriages. Results were expected Saturday.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
